alert.note: Alert for Lower Tangipahoa; Northern St. Tammany; Southern Livingston; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. John The Baptist (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 3:14PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern St. John The Baptist, northwestern St. Tammany, northeastern Livingston and southern Tangipahoa Parishes through 345 PM CDT... At 313 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ponchatoula, or 10 miles south of Hammond. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Covington, Ponchatoula, Abita Springs, Albany, Madisonville, Folsom, Springfield, Natalbany, Robert, Killian and Tickfaw. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 28 and 66. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 12 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Lower Tangipahoa; Northern St. Tammany; Southern Livingston; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. John The Baptist
